name: **Inishtreh – _Inis Troighe_**
description: Inishtreh – Inis Troighe L739-371 Sheet 44 This is an unattractive, flat, ungrazed lump of heather, gorse and reeds, in a beautiful setting. It guards the eastern side of the entrance to Bertraghboy Bay. Very extensive areas dry out on E & S sides. The holy well shown on the OS sheet on the NE side has not been found. In winter 2008, Sanderling, Turnstone, Snipe, Rock Pipit, Starling, and Chaffinch feeding on extensive amounts of seaweed thrown up at NE corner. Land on the eastern side or walk out at LW from a beautiful quay at L742-367. Periwinkles.
